| History                 = Cordco, Inc. is a [[Long Island]] research firm affiliated with [[Stark Industries|Stark Enterprises]]: they let the [[Empire State University]] use their launch facility to put a satellite into orbit to study the [[Earth]] ley lines.

While the experimental rocket sat on the launch pad, [[Spider-Man (Peter Parker)|Spider-Man]] defeated an industrial spy, who was taking pictures of that secret ship on behalf of [[Stane International]].{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 1 #335}}

The private launch facilities were secretly under surveillance by [[Otto Octavius (Earth-616)|Doctor Octopus]], thanks to the security schematics stolen by [[Maxwell Dillon (Earth-616)|Electro]] in the [[Henly Building]]. While Peter Parker was attending the rocket launch, the [[Sinister Six (Earth-616)|Sinister Six attacked]]. As Spider-Man fought them, Ock loaded his poison dispersal unit into the rocket. Grabbing Spidey, Ock prepared to tear him apart, but [[William Baker (Earth-616)|Sandman]] stopped him. Ock used a ray gun to turn Sandman into glass, then forced the Cordco staff to launch the rocket. [[Jason Macendale Jr. (Earth-616)|Hobgoblin]] took his pilfered poison capsule and dumped it in Spider-Man's face.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 1 #338}}

The Sinister Six didn't understand why Ock's poison did't kill Spider-Man, so Ock revealed that it was actually a drug that caused extreme convulsions in cocaine users; the Sinister Six fled, vowing revenge, while Spider-Man restored Sandman to his normal form. Having learned that Octopus' chemical was depleting the ozone layer at a devastating rate, Spider-Man returned at night to Cordco Incorporated to have [[Thor Odinson (Earth-616)|Thor]] launch a prototype satellite into orbit, in order to spray a burundite mist and deactivate the poison effect by [[Mjolnir|Mjolnir's]] mighty wind.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 1 #339}}
